intro: Dioscorea guaranitica var. balansae, commonly known as the Balansá yam, is a tuberous perennial plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Dioscoreaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by elongated, fleshy fruits containing numerous seeds. Its tuberous roots are the primary economically valuable part, used in traditional medicine and as a food source. The species is also noted for its ecological importance in supporting biodiversity within its native habitat.
